intro: Nigera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered nigera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, making it an attractive addition to gardens. Nigera parviflora is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
